sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 13:07  
tharindu\_ - (08/05/2009 13:18): sdumitriu: Hi, I tried with firefox2 but I get following error  
tharindu\_ - (08/05/2009 13:18): /usr/lib/firefox/firefox-bin: error while loading shared libraries: libstdc++.so.5: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory  
tharindu\_ - (08/05/2009 13:18): /usr/lib/firefox is the firefox2 folder I just downloaded and unpacked  
sdumitriu - (08/05/2009 13:18): Yeah, that's ugly  
sdumitriu - (08/05/2009 13:18): You can do this:  
sdumitriu - (08/05/2009 13:19): keep FF3  
sdumitriu - (08/05/2009 13:19): Edit distribution-tests/pom.xml and look for <selenium.version>  
tharindu\_ - (08/05/2009 13:20): ok  
tharindu\_ - (08/05/2009 13:20): $selenium.version  
sdumitriu - (08/05/2009 13:20): Hm, no, not there  
sdumitriu - (08/05/2009 13:21): Edit selenium-tests/pom.xml and search for selenium-maven-plugin  
sdumitriu - (08/05/2009 13:21): And change with 1.0-rc-1  
sdumitriu - (08/05/2009 13:22): Make sure FF3 is on the PATH  
sdumitriu - (08/05/2009 13:22): Execute:  
sdumitriu - (08/05/2009 13:22): which firefox-bin  
rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 13:22  
tharindu\_ - (08/05/2009 13:22): but I could not see firefox-bin file in my firefox 3 folder   
tharindu\_ - (08/05/2009 13:22): only firefox file was there  
tharindu\_ - (08/05/2009 13:23): /usr/lib/firefox-3.0.10/  
tharindu\_ - (08/05/2009 13:23): in that I see only firefox file   
sdumitriu - (08/05/2009 13:23): Are you sure?  
sdumitriu - (08/05/2009 13:23): It should be  
tharindu\_ - (08/05/2009 13:24): shall i paste what I get when I list the files here  
tharindu\_ - (08/05/2009 13:24): I was also confused with this  
tharindu\_ - (08/05/2009 13:25): because when I search I saw telling to point to firefox-bin  
tharindu\_ - (08/05/2009 13:26): a file named firefox.sh is also there  
sdumitriu - (08/05/2009 13:27): Download a fresh targz from getfirefox.com  
sdumitriu - (08/05/2009 13:27): Unpack it in your home folder  
sdumitriu - (08/05/2009 13:28): Make sure it has a firefox-bin inside it  
sdumitriu - (08/05/2009 13:28): Then do the PATH trick I said in the mail  
tharindu\_ - (08/05/2009 13:29): you mean a copy of firefox 3?  I tried this method for firefox2 that had firefox-bin file, which gave the above error. I will try again  
sdumitriu - (08/05/2009 13:30): Yes, try with FF3 + new version of selenium maven plugin  
tharindu\_ left at 14:00 ("Leaving")  
marta\_ left at 14:03 (Read error: 113 (No route to host))  
marta\_ joined #xwiki at 14:12  
vmassol - (08/05/2009 14:31): hmmm anyone know who's importing stuff on xwiki.org?  
vmassol - (08/05/2009 14:35): jvelociter: what is this doing http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Applications/GroovyConsoleApplication ? it's executing groovy remotely?  
jvelociter - (08/05/2009 14:35): yep  
vmassol - (08/05/2009 14:35): so it's not using the groovy engine inside xwiki right?  
jvelociter - (08/05/2009 14:35): it is  
vmassol - (08/05/2009 14:35): (but executing the one on app engine)  
jvelociter - (08/05/2009 14:35): no no  
vmassol - (08/05/2009 14:35): hmm then I don't get it  
vmassol - (08/05/2009 14:36): what's the diff with putting groovy in a page?  
jvelociter - (08/05/2009 14:36): Guillaume's code was for app engine, but I made it a xwiki service  
jvelociter - (08/05/2009 14:36): it's an AJAX console  
jvelociter - (08/05/2009 14:36): blog post coming in 2min, you'll see ;)  
vmassol - (08/05/2009 14:36): ok so you can put , run execute, then put new code execute again, etc  
vmassol - (08/05/2009 14:36): ok :)  
vmassol - (08/05/2009 14:37): s/can put/can put code/  
vmassol - (08/05/2009 14:37): I think I get it  
jvelociter - (08/05/2009 14:37): yep  
vmassol - (08/05/2009 14:37): apparently is has syntax coloring too  
jvelociter - (08/05/2009 14:37): and save scripts, too  
vmassol - (08/05/2009 14:37): ok  
jvelociter - (08/05/2009 14:37): yes  
jvelociter - (08/05/2009 14:37): it uses codemirror for this  
jvelociter - (08/05/2009 14:37): works good  
jvelociter - (08/05/2009 14:37): I tried to integrate codemirror in xwiki couple of months ago  
jvelociter - (08/05/2009 14:38): I had bugs, so I stopped  
jvelociter - (08/05/2009 14:38): I should try again, because it's really nice  
vmassol - (08/05/2009 14:40): we didn't want to run the code macro syntax highlighting on the client with thomas that's why we didn't use http://code.google.com/p/syntaxhighlighter/  
vmassol - (08/05/2009 14:41): for ex you won't get the highlight in PDFs if you do it on the client  
vmassol - (08/05/2009 14:44): jvelociter: the syntax highlighting on the fly as you type is nice ;)  
jvelociter - (08/05/2009 14:46): yes thomas told me that yesterday  
jvelociter - (08/05/2009 14:46): but pigments is good too
